title: Sabine River (Texas–Louisiana)
summary: The Sabine River (/səˈbiːn/) is a 360-mile (580 km) long river[5][6] in the Southern U.S. states of Texas and Louisiana,[3] From the 32nd parallel north and downstream, it serves as part of the boundary between the two states and empties into Sabine Lake, an estuary of the Gulf of Mexico.
